content:
@Lloyd McKenzie @Grahame Grieve We got publish failed in Trifolia. Please take a look at the error message below. Thank you.
org.apache.commons.exec.ExecuteException: Process exited with an error: 1 (Exit value: 1)
at org.apache.commons.exec.DefaultExecutor.executeInternal(DefaultExecutor.java:404)
at org.apache.commons.exec.DefaultExecutor.execute(DefaultExecutor.java:166)
at org.apache.commons.exec.DefaultExecutor.execute(DefaultExecutor.java:153)
at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.runJekyll(Publisher.java:5384)
at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.runTool(Publisher.java:5290)
at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.generate(Publisher.java:4757)
at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.createIg(Publisher.java:859)
at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.execute(Publisher.java:708)
at org.hl7.fhir.igtools.publisher.Publisher.main(Publisher.java:7835)
IG Publisher finished with code 1
The HL7 IG Publisher failed. The HL7 IG Publisher tool is not developed as part of Trifolia-on-FHIR; it is developed by HL7. If you are still having issues after having reviewed and addressed ToF errors reported in the log above, go to chat.fhir.org to get more information on how to proceed.

@Cheng Liu
it's not clear if you are reporting an issue, or what you are asking (or the context) or why you specific ping Lloyd or Grahame.
https://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=FHIR_Rules_for_asking_questions
@Jose Costa Teixeira Yes, I'm reporting an issue. Sorry that I forgot to ping you. Please take a look at this issue. Thanks

I also don't understand why why you'd ping me specifically :) is there anything that only Lloyd, grahame or myself can help?
Also, this is the committers thread. Perhaps you meant the IG creation thread? https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179252-IG-creation
Try to provide more context - what is the IG? what are you trying to do? Did you try to fix it? What did you try?
With Trifolia, @Sean McIlvenna is your primary support. However, he'll need more of the log than you've provided. What was the message before it blew up?
